title: Effective Spearfishing Methods
brief: Use improvised spears to catch fish in shallow water with proper technique.
steps: Step 1: Make spear from long straight sapling, sharpen end or attach knife/metal point.
Step 2: Alternative: split shaft few inches from end, insert wood spreader, sharpen both halves.
Step 3: Find areas where fish gather or fish runs in waist-deep water with good visibility.
Step 4: Place spear point into water and move slowly toward fish to avoid startling them.
Step 5: Account for light refraction - fish appear higher in water than actual position.
Step 6: With sudden push, impale fish against stream bottom rather than trying to lift with spear.
Step 7: Hold spear with one hand, grab and secure fish with the other hand.
warnings: Never throw the spear, especially if point is a knife - you cannot afford to lose it.
Light refraction makes fish appear in different position than reality.
Fish will slip off spear if you try to lift them - always grab with free hand.
Work slowly and patiently to avoid spooking fish in the area.
